Reviews.Title: “great hotel & location for airport”
Reviews.Author: ewanwr
Reviews.Content: ideally located just 10 mins drive from schiphol by free hotel bus/taxi. Rooms were very large and of a high standard. We had a lovely meal in the hotel which was very well priced - staff were friendly and helpfull - also free wifi in hotel

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fiona B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of Schipol airport hotels and this time chose it as it was one of the cheapest in its star rating and because it has free, quick and regular shuttle service connecting to airport and trains to city centre. ( some of the others charge! ) The rooms are clean and beds are comfortable but don't expect fancy toiletries. The hotel is undergoing renovation/building work to its public areas so facilities are limited to a rather impersonal and slightly clinical temporary coffee and breakfast area. Not a hotel to spend a lot of time in but one for ease of access and good nights sleep

Reviews.Title: “Industrial and under reconstruction”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2504
Reviews.Content: They should have closed this hotel for repair. Insteadchanging it while keeping it open. When I was there it was full, bus loads of tourists arriving, blocking the entire (reduced) reception area and overwhelming the pitiful restaurant, bar and other amenities. Literally the bar is 4 feet long, the restaurant is in a corridor and the only other place for miles is a vending maching in reception that was mostly empty. Shuttle from schipol was good, but its clear that there is nothing around this hotel at all except an industrial estate, no public transport (almost unheard of in the Netherlands), nothing. Only pick this hotel if you have no other airport choice, at least till they finish the repair

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, weird location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: MyTasteHisTaste
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night due to work location. The hotel would be perfect for people flying early in the morning or need an overnight stay between the flights. The shuttle runs between 5.30am (i think) to 11.30pm, will not be convenient for travelers who have flights i between those hours. By public transport, it's difficult to get there or anywhere else without taking longer than 30 minutes. The free shuttle service could bring you to and from the airport every 30 minutes, from the airport you can take the train to the cities you need to go to. Would not stay here if Amsterdam is where you want to visit every day. This is the only hotel we have stayed in Netherlands which allow 2pm late check out. Well done! Most hotels want you out by 10am, some 12noon without allowing for late check out. The front office and cleaning staffs are very friendly. The standard room is not spacious but enough for one night or two. There is no view or anything fancy. Hotel charges breakfast at Euro20 per head, if you want to save the money, take the shuttle and eat something at the airport and then back to hotel. If it was not included in my room rate, wouldn't have paid that money for the breakfast. There is nothing else around the hotel (walking distance) where you can eat to do leisure stuffs. Wireless signal is not strong but you get free cable internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Airport Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MegMcD12
Reviews.Content: The Park Plaza has a complimentary Airport Shuttle that runs every 30 mins. They gave perfect instructions as to where and when to catch their shuttle. Even though the hotel is undergoing some renovation, it is nicely covered up and not obstructive at all. My room was spacious, crisp, and very clean. The internet hook up in the room was not working at first, but the staff came to work on the problem right away. We realized it was not compatible with my Macbook, so the staff recommended I call the internet help line from the room phone. Once I connected with an operator and ran through the steps and settings, I was connected in 2 minutes! I can not say enough good things about how nice and helpful the staff was. The hotel also has a complimentary breakfast, which was tasty as well. Overall, this hotel is the perfect night's stay for an airport layover.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay, not exceeding expectations”
Reviews.Author: vvv36
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a modern one, clean and attractive. The rooms are very spacious, the bathroom is also quite large but the bathroom's door is made of glass which can be a little unpleasant, even if you travel as a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: Roseleaf
Reviews.Content: This has a real budget feel. The light is so dim in the room 60+ year old eyes could not read a map. The raised thresh hold of the bathroom is easy to trip over. The lobby area where WI-FI is free is FREEZING! Even young people had their coats on. Your room key is a card that makes the electricity work in the room. Since you have to take it when you leave, you cannot leave your camera or other equipment charging while you're at dinner. Dinner was over-priced and not special. The breakfast buffet is very nice and a good value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “ideal”
Reviews.Author: mrbusy
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a night at the Park Plaza, it was christmas eve so hotel very quiet.We had booked the park sleep and fly option.On arrival we was met at reception by very friendly staff who booked us in .It was early afternoon so we used the shuttle service to the airport, and then got the train into Amsterdam Central, by far the best way.The driver of the hotel bus was very friendly and helpfull, and was picked up at the airport later in the evening, no need to pre book.We didnt eat in the hotel so cant comment on the food, but we did enjoy a drink in the bar, again served by very friendly staff.The room was warm and clean, had all you need for a one night stop over. The following morning the bus was on time and took us to the airport, no problems at all.Two weeks later on our return from Norway we got the shuttle bus back to hotel and told reception we was taking our car, just so they can take it from their security system.All in all had a pleasent stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel but fairly basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: acerbic-twit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business meeting in early December. Quite a good shuttle service from the airport - but beware on the way back you have to pre-book and it can get busy. Staff very courteous. Had a very nice meal in the restaurant with high quality food. The cheesboard was particularly memorable having the stinkiest cheese ever - but that is good - I get fed up with bland cheeseboards! The room let the hotel down slightly - very basic with no frills. No carpet - just wood flooring. The lighting was extremely dingy making it diffcult to apply make-up as the only area to do it was on the bathroom leaning a long way over the sink. Evening reading with the bedside light on was slightly difficult. The toiletries in the bathroom were very basic and absolutely no touches of luxury. It was all very functional which is OK for a business trip but wouldn't rush back.

Reviews.Title: “Not for early morning travelers”
Reviews.Author: Serass
Reviews.Content: First of all the shuttle bus service is poor - bus is available every half a hour... Second - the bus is very small, it was a Fiat for 8 seat places... Fortunately, I was one of the first who came to the bus and I got place in the bus! Inside the hotel is OK, clean and friendly. Do not accept rooms with 16, 18, 20 on the end - rooms are near the elevators and you will hear all talks, laugh and screams of the people coming from the elevator. Not pretty, especially when you will sleep and need some rest... If you have early flight - this hotel is not for you, because first bus departs 05:30 and breakfast starts at 06:00... so you will be hungry. by the way, they forget to prepare my breakfast bag, so I got is last minute... Oh, do not forget to ask on the reception bus ticket, otherwise you'll have no place in the bus. In the restaurant - there is not much to choice for food... but food is tasty.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of nowhere”
Reviews.Author: Voyageur380
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel, but very cold atmosphere. Functional rooms, but not enough light to work. The only possible activity at night is to sleep. No wifi in room, just ethernet (slow) connection. Friendly staff. Convenient for one night business layover, not more.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, fresh, great service”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneLola
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this hotel and would highly recommend it. The hotel seems new, fresh, very clean and comfortable. Front desk staff very efficient and friendly. Restaurant served good quality, averaged price food. Buffett breakfast was very good, with amazing variety. We asked to take a tray upstairs, as one of the members of our party was unwell, which was promptly brought to us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Amsterdam airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: ColesDad1
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if you are needing a hotel near the airport.I upgrade to a suite.Two bathrooms,bath tub offie area.Nice.Great way to end my vacation.Had a early flight back to the states.The hotel runs a free shuttle to the airport.Use it to shop(cheaper groceries at the airport than down town A-dam) and to eat.Never ate at the hotel.Why when you can pick up a decent meal at the airport.Hassle free way to end a great trip,got the all you can watch deal(video games,movies tv} and caught up on my viewing.I guess i was jonesing after a week of bad hotel tv and no time left in the day for tv.Also you need a tub to soak your feet after a week on cobblestone.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Functional, Pleasant - somewhere in the middle.”
Reviews.Author: travelbypairs
Reviews.Content: It's an airport business hotel i guess, but not that near an airport. Upon entrance, it appears very modern, functional and pleasant but the feeling you get is somewhat cold and distant so for a 5 country - europe trip that we did, while this hotel did not fare badly at all, it was not too memorable either. Asked for a double but they could only give a twin over here. Some hotels would have tried to mitigate the gap but putting 2 layers of it across the 2 beds to make the in between line less uncomfortable but they did not. Free Wifi was available at the lobby and in the room, it was only through the cable. However if it's really a business hotel, i think they should upgrade it to wireless internet in the rooms too, otherwise with ipads, you can't use the cable unless you have a laptop. Coffee/tea making facilities were available. Bathroom was modern with a wide sink and hairdryer plus the soft lighting was nice. No bathtub in this room but it's fine with me. A bit of trouble for me to turn the shower on as it's a bit different from the usual H for Hot and C for Cold adjustments. Would have preferred the complimentary shampoo/soap to come in take-away bottles instead of just a large multi-purpose pump bottle. Something about the layout that i didn't feel too good about -- if someone is sitting at the desk surfing on their laptops and you just came out from the shower, you couldn't really pass through from the shower to get to the bedroom without the person moving from the desk/chair. Lastly, we stayed for 1 night and had not yet checked out as it was only around 7.50am so we did not appreciate that the cleaning lady had already knocked on our doors and opened them up to ask to clean the room. Oh dear. Thankfully we had already woken up and getting ready to go out.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: reefsharkDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel last weekend and were very happy with all aspects of our stay. Reception staff were accommodating and friendly, our room was lovely and the overall appearance of the hotel was very pleasing and modern. Good food and prices in hotel restaurant. Transport links to the city were straight forward and frequent- 10 minute brisk walk to the tram stop, then 20mins journey into central st. We were very happy being out of the city center and would happily recommend to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, modern, nice room”
Reviews.Author: fivesheds
Reviews.Content: Only downside was check in where the service should have been better. Otherwise a good modern hotel, well located & very good meeting room facility Very convenient to airport with free shuttle bus service Very good business meeting room facility & services Food was good Limited TV channel choice Room AC worked Bedroom was clean Some noise from bathroom drains when water flushed from other rooms Large hotel with huge open spaces Good value Recommend for airport (Schipol) only not as base for central Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “A somewhat inconvenient 45 min from Amsterdam city center”
Reviews.Author: LincolnshireMike
Reviews.Content: My biggest complaint about the is hotel is its location. Due to a conference taking place in town, rooms were hard to come by in the city center, so we opted for the Park Plaza as it was only a "20 min tram ride" into the city. However this does not include the 22 min walk to the nearest tram station (or 15 min if you walk briskly). This distance is just far enough to make a taxi seem like a waste of money, and walking to feel like a waste of time. A 90 minute roundtrip to the city is not great if you're here as a tourist. The hotel itself is also overpriced (approx $400 / night), but this could just be due to the conference that was running that week. I booked a double room, and it came with two twin beds pushed together. The rooms were functional, but do not plan on doing anything but sleeping and taking a shower. The room has a safe, 22" LCD tv, and both European and UK power sockets. Everywhere in the hotel was clean and tidy - rooms and public spaces. The hotel staff was excellent - professional, but not unfriendly. While I like to speak different languages when I travel in Europe, it was a nice break that everyone speaks English here. Breakfast was not great. Buffet-style: cereals, fruit, pastries, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, baked beans, mushrooms, tomatoes. So everything was there, but the flavors were off somehow (e.g. extra-salty bacon, watery coffee). Also the juices weren't re-filled for quite some time.... not sure what was going on there. Free WiFi in the lobby only - in the rooms, you have a wired connection only. There is ample (secure) parking available. In summary, not a great location, but a clean and functional 3-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Souless warehousing for people”
Reviews.Author: lindsay_williams
Reviews.Content: I hope never to have to stay at this hotel again. It is huge, modern and souless. I found lots of irritations. The room was perfectly adequate although no mini-bar and room service has very limited hours. The TV had only three English language channels, all news. There was a kettle and tea tray but there was no milk included, and having eaten my complimentary biscuit on arrival it was not replaced in my two days there. Breakfast was basic and the cooked items I tried (beans sausage and poor bacon) were only luke warm. Coffee and tea come from one machine in the corner which got busy and also broke down while I was waiting for a second cup of tea. Reception seemed under-staffed and the people on duty spent a lot of time talking to each other, even when there was a long queue of people waiting. The worst thing about this hotel is that there is nothing of interest or comfort about the place and it is situated on an industrial estate 15 minutes expensive taxi ride from the centre of town. It had free wi-fi in the communal areas and a plug in internet connection in the room. To be fair it was clean and, from a functional point of view well designed.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hctom
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Very clean, never ate there but looked very good as well. The second day they forgot to bring us towels, ( we discovered this when we returned at 11PM) but a call to the desk delivered them promplty. Close proximity to airport without the noise of the planes. A little out of the way, but they have a free shuttle if you reserve it in advance. Very easy access to the trains in the station at the airport or the trams a 10minute walk away to get you to Amsterdam downtown. The taxi service is just as fast, but will cost you 25eruo to the airport alone! Front desk staff were very courteous and shuttle drivers very interactive and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: jmee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in an executive room for two nights, and its vastly overpriced for what you get (at the nearly 200 euros a night that I paid, I expected a LOT more than what I was faced with). It is certainly not a 4* hotel by any recognised international standard (I have stayed in better serviced and maintained 2* hotels). The airport transfer service is unreliable (waited for nearly an hour in the rain for it to arrive at Schiphol), and the staff in check-in are painfully slow (the comments below about long waits for check-in despite being the only person there sound familiar). Check out was worse, with ill trained staff who clearly had no idea what they were doing taking nearly 5 minutes to check a single guest out leading to long queues of extremely irate guests. While at first glance the room looked good, I soon found that appearances can be deceptive. The rooms aren't cleaned properly (I found rubbish from previous guests left in drawers and cupboards in the room) and there was damage to several appliances in the room which had not been attended to (in one instance, pieces had been swept under the sofa). The gym is pitiful (six old machines in an ill ventilated room, with a limit of 5 people at any time in it) which would explain the lack of signposting to it and the reluctance of the check-in staff to grant access to it. Overall, the combination of rotten customer service, high prices and terrible location (the website says ten minutes from the airport, but fails to mention it is ten minutes at 120kph down a motorway) really make this a dreadful place to stay. Probably okay for a one night stay when passing through the airport if theres nowhere else available, anything longer than that and you would be better to find somewhere decent. I certainly will not be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “poor response of front desk people”
Reviews.Author: stranger50
Reviews.Content: i had stayed in this hotel from 22/07/2011 to 25/07/2011. i admit i had smoked in the room which i was not aware of that this is no smoking zone hotel. i smoked in my room no 535 the very momment i entered as i was tired of travel from paris to holland. this was my first and the last cigerate i smoked in the room. but to my surprise the day/ momment we were to check out from hotel to catch my flight back home. i was asked by the front desk girl to pay Euro 150 . i asked what for this was. she told me that u have smoked in the room and u have to pay a fine of 150 euros. to my utter surprised i asked the receprtion girl that u should have informed me first when i checked in hoel about no smoking. second they should have told me then and there on 22nd jully 2011 when i smoked where as u r telling my now on 25th julythe mommemt i was checking out.she refused to answer my question and i siad i dont have any maoney with me left since i was travelling back to my country. she refused to listen i asked her to let me talk to the manager of the hotel but even there she went and came back and i was refused entry to the manager room. . luckly i had some money kept with me for my return journey. i paid the fine of 150 euro for which i had planned for last minute shopping for my family and frds and my eating. which i had to forgo for this because of the the hotel employes including the manager of this hotel

Reviews.Title: “2 stays for early morning flights”
Reviews.Author: slivers86
Reviews.Content: paid $215 cdn per night for 2 seperate stays in September of 2011. Both stays were flawless, rooms neat and tidy. My girlfriend and I were comfortable, and felt the beds were average when it came to comfort, a little stiff. The 'queen' bed was actually two singles pushed together, so don't count on getting close to your spouse, as the beds push apart. Other than the beds, we were happy. The shuttle picks you up at A9, outside of arrivals. Friendly shuttle drivers - no cost with a reservation. Picks up at the airport at :00 and :30 throughout the day from 5 am to 11 pm. Shuttle was always on time, and is about 10 minutes. MAKE SURE to book your shuttle to the airport as soon as you arrive. Saw a disappointed couple - more so the female - when they were denied our bus due to not booking. The breakfast at the hotel for 11 euro is second to none. buffet style my girlfriend and i agreed it was the best hotel food we had ever had for breakfast. The Wifi only worked on the main floor, unless you have a laptop, than you can hardwire your computer into the network. Desk staff were friendly and helpful. I would stay here again and found it is cheaper to call the hotel and book than any online travel companies.

Reviews.Title: “No Customer focus, unclean and no value for money”
Reviews.Author: fkft_dhyani
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller with over 150 nights spent in hotels every year (I am starwood gold member, Accor AClub gold). I didnt like this hotel at all reason being. I normally stay at Radisson, first time at Park Plaza a) Time to wait at reception (only one person), she had us wait for over 15 minutes. We were the only people there. b) I asked for a King bed as our 2 year old daughter sleeps with us, they asked us to upgrade to a executive room after 35 euro payment, we did that. Surprise was in store, the bed is the same. I couldnt make the staff understand in plain english. Gave up completly. c) hotel has bugs on their bedsheets, wires are hanging from overhead lights. Overall i dont recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: meetjimbo
Reviews.Content: Although a bit further out on the motorway than the other airport properties, this was an excellent choice when it came to quality of the rooms, service and restaurant. The internet was extremely fast and the transportation to/from Schiphol Airport very convenient running every 30 minutes. Overall, a nice comfortable stay at a great value. The cleanliness and modern feel of the hotel were welcome. It's a convenient hotel to save some money, take the train into town and enjoy the rest of Amsterdam if only staying a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean, efficient staff and service but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: KenJCanada
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Park Plaza was very pleasant. It is a good hotel with excellent value. We toured through England, Holland, Germany and Czech Republic and our per night stay in Amsterdam was incredibly low. Even though we were out of the centre of Amsterdam I was very pleased to pay only 46 Euros a night. With the free shuttle to Schiphol's train station (8 minutes) and a 15 minute ride to the city centre, it really was convenient. The young ladies who serve you at the front desk are first rate; they gave us excellent advice, accurate directions and quick but personal service even though we were at the hotel during a very busy time. I would definitely stay at the Park Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved IT !”
Reviews.Author: forpriyank Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Truly appreciate the hotel, decor, surroundings and the cleanliness. Little out of city but just 20 min drive away.. peaceful location.. nice cozy rooms with basic amenities.. spacious parking, moderately charged at 10 Euros / day.. We loved the stay, would love to be back

Reviews.Title: “rude and unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: tassie7
Reviews.Content: After a full day of traveling we chose this hotel for convenience. We were delayed due to lost bags. Our experience started with the free pickup. The driver raced straight through and missed us, then on the next round he wasn't going to take us cause they were full. He fortunately let us on board as it was raining and cold. We get to the hotel and check in was smooth. The room was absolutely tiny and for the cost, definitely not worth it. We were starving as hadn't eaten in ages and were told there was no food available as kitchen shut at 11pm. This is a 5 star hotel! Surely to be 5 star there would be 24 hour room service at the very least! They told us our only option was to use the vending machine which I must say was pretty much empty! Finally, to top it all off, we took our hunger to the bar for peanuts and a few quite drinks. It was supposed to be open till 1pm, the barman obviously had other ideas and wanted an early mark! He was rude and disrespectful, switching lights off around us, not serving us for ages between each drink, and talking to colleagues at the other end of the bar. We weren't the only people drinking at the bar! Finally the free internet is only available in a small area at reception. I certainly would not recommend this hotel to stay at, there are plenty more close to the airport without the attitude of the staff at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Overnight Stay for AMS Airport”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay86
Reviews.Content: All in all, this was a good place to stay. It's advertised as an Airport hotel and although it does have a shuttle to/from the airport, the location is about 10 minutes away. No problem for us, but just wanted all to know that it's not directly at the airport. We found the rooms to be very nice, I personally like the bathroom layout but I know others have commented about the glass door (it is frosted). The bed was the only strange thing....it was two double beds pushed together on a wood floor with roller castor bottoms. The beds would slip apart quite often (we lost the remoted three times in the crack). When trying to get to the airport, definitely check with the front desk and get put on the 'list'. We did not do this and we were not made aware that we needed to do this and so when we went to leave for the airport, we were told it was full and that we could take the train in (20 min walk to station) or call a taxi on our dime. I was a bit upset by this news as one reason we booked this hotel was for the free shuttle. The hotel manager on duty however, decided to take care of the taxi bill for us. So for that reason, I would definitely recommend and return to this hotel. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “For sure you'll find better option close to Schiphol”
Reviews.Author: Collector582
Reviews.Content: STRENGHTS: Free shuttle bus WEAKNESSES: Breakfast definitely below standard, ugly and dirty corridors, average room, night staff at reception horrible- didn't even check reserved type of room TOTAL: Of course could be worse but definitely will find other hotel for next transit at AMS Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - not a great night sleep”
Reviews.Author: AngelFishLush
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in May on a business trip. The hotel runs a free airport transfer every 30 minutes from the main terminal and it takes around 10 minutes to get to the hotel. The staff were excellent and extremely helpful. The rooms seemed fairly new and were very clean. There was a slight damp smell in the shower but nothing major. The dissapointment was the beds! Not comfy! Rubbish pillows and the single beds were on wheels! Thats ok on carpet but on wood flooring you are too scared to move in case the bed heads over to the otherside of the room! I woke up extremely tired and with a feeling of motion sickness! Breakfast was very nice with good coffee and selection of food. Not bad for one night but certainly wouldnt stay longer - need my sleep!

Reviews.Title: “We had a good deal but not a very good experience”
Reviews.Author: DutchyCan
Reviews.Content: We had a good deal, around 90 euro including park and fly option. Now that I am looking for a new deal, I can not find one and shoudl pay almost double for 1 night plus park and fly option. That is too expensive for this hotel! First: it is not too close to the airport. The hotel looks nice though, businessstyle and the room is sufficiently big, an okay bathroom, maybe a bit too modern design, but everything clean. The location is in a business district, and because they have a shuttlebus to Schiphol airport, they can call it an airport hotel. With a good deal this is a good option, better than Ibis (and with the deal I mentioned before, this was cheaper than Ibis... but now it is 30 euro more... not a good option!) This used to be the Holiday Inn (same hotel, different name). So you know what quality to expect. All in all: an okay sleepexperience. A few points of criticism. There are two spots to park a car. Upstairs at the entrance, in front of the lobby. Where your car can be seen and where you can enter the entrance. Or downstairs, where there is few light in the evening, where the door to the entrance is locked in the evening (so you can NOT enter, what a joke!) and where it basically feels very unsafe. There you would not want to park your car for several weeks! But if there is no space upstairs, you might have to. We luckilly had the space upstairs. All in all, when you come in the evening and there is only parking downstairs, you probably feel very bad for choosing this hotel. Going outside and up with all your suitcases, duh! The wordt point for us though: when I came back the shuttle bus on Schiphol airport left me standing 2 times. Yes, 2 times. First time I just missed it but ran and waived... no response, could be bad luck. Second time, the bus stood in a completely different spot parked and when I noticed and waived in front, it completely ignored me (female busdriver) and drove without stopping, I also ran behind it... nothing. If they would come by every 20 minutes, it would be a bit okay, but they don't. So all in all: a good deal but not a very good experience. Only with a price under 100 euro with park and fly option I would consider this hotel again... Otherwise: not!

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Euroscrote
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here over the Mayday holiday wekend mainly because we could not find anything suitable in the city centre. It was a very reasonable hotel of its sort. The room was clean and comfortable. The food in the resturant and at breakfast was workmanlike, if not inspiring, but one does not go to the Netherlands for haute cuisine. The staff were pleasant and helpful, although service was sometimes a little laid back for Mrs E. One word of warning - the website said that there was a tramstop nearby, with frequent services to the city centre. This was true but the 15 minutes quoted to walk there proved a bit of an underestimate for Mrs E, who I think I have mentioned before does not really do walking.

Reviews.Title: “Not a airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amyeeee
Reviews.Content: More bad points than good I'm afraid. Good: Shuttle bus is twice every hour to and from airport, and drivers are friendly. Quiet Clean Bad: Before arriving, their is no information about where the hotel shuttle buses are, and despite emailing, the hotel never replied. As it turned out it was quite easy, as there are signs as you exit the airport. Shuttle bus only holds 8 people per time. Pillows were like the cushions you get on sofas. I'm not sure if thats normal in Holland, but it was very uncomfortable to sleep on. Breakfast was disgusting! Its 20 euros pp, and runs from 6.30-10.30.We went about half 9ish, so I'm not sure if we should have gone earlier, but it was cold and there was very little choice! For 20 euros pp its a complete rip off. Finally, this is not an aiport hotel. It takes about 15 minutes to get to and from the airport on the bus, you definitely cannot walk there! The reason we chose this hotel was so we could leave our luggage in the luggage room on our final day and quickly pick it up before we boarded the plane. In the end we took our stuff to the lockers at the airport (6 euros) as it would have been a hassle to go all the way back to the hotel after coming back in from Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “glass door to the bathroom!!!”
Reviews.Author: srecka
Reviews.Content: Glass door to the bathroom,so if you share a room with someone better do not use a toilet.The same breakfast every morning, and they do not add any additional quantities of food being eaten.Away from the city

Reviews.Title: “best conference hotel at great rates”
Reviews.Author: grundeep
Reviews.Content: this is a 4 star hotel, quite basic but clean and confortable.the front office staff is efficient and friendly, hotel managers very professional and customer oriented.f&b is a bit poor but they are improving this.rates meet the customers' needs. a very good location!xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Clean, attractive, efficient, but terrible dining options.”
Reviews.Author: MSedita
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for three nights to attend a conference at the hote. The rooms are average size, very clean and the furnishings are new and nicely styled. The hotels caters primarily to business people, airline staff, and those needing to be close to the airport. The locale is a commercial/industrial area, not ugly, but there are no retail establishments with walking distance. The metro stop is a short walk away, however I'm told that is is the local with many stops to city center. The hote has a free shuttle to the airport, from which youmcna take a quick train ride to downtown for about 7 euros, this sees the best bet. The shuttle only runs till 11pm, and a taxi back from the airport will set you back 25 euros. Now, about the food. The free breakfast was excellent. Dinner, however, was another matter. The one restaurant had a dinner menu with 4 entrees, none of which were very appealing. I ordered the "Tom Yam" which is supposed to be a mixed seafood dinner. Twenty-five euros will get you one mussel, one shrimp, and two tiny pieces of fish, in a tangy sauce. Looked nice, and tasted ok, but it would have left a bird hungry. My wife had a "seared" tuna appetizer on greens, which was three small, too well cooked pieces of tuna on sweet pickle slices. I saw later there was a bar menu, of which I was not aware. The following evening I tried to order a cheeseburger but was told they were all out! Discussion with others revealed the burgers weren't very good, but at least they had substance. I settled for "Van Dobben" veal croquettes, a prepared snack food. The thing is, there are no other options other than

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a few quirks.”
Reviews.Author: Born_Old
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an excutive room that was well equiped and generally comfortable. There are a few design oddities in these rooms. For example the coffee kettle did not plug in at the workdesk or in the bathroom so I ended up having the coffee tray on the floor. Also the toilet is very small (think aircraft) and situated well away from the bathroom. The room air conditioner did not seem to work and, even though it was January, the room was too warm for sleeping with the duvet. A quick call to housekeeping got me a extra sheet instead and also plenty of coffee supplies for my day of work. Overall the staff are excellent and almost everyone was extremely helpful. The one exception was a front desk clerk when I queried the fact that I was being asked to pay for Internet access in the room. One of the reasons for choosing this hotel was the free Internet access in rooms that is specifically advertised on their web site. When I logged in I was asked to pay 22 euros for 24 hours of access. I asked at the front desk and the clerk told me that free access was only available in public areas. I got the code for that, logged on and then went back to the front desk with the hotel's web page stating room access was free on my screen. At that point the clerk finally told me how to access the Internet free in the room. 22 euros is an outrageous amount for hotel Internet access and my review would have been very different if this was not resolved. Overall, I very mch enjoyed my stay. The food was good and the breakfast is great.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly accommodation after flight got cancelled”
Reviews.Author: Haarlem
Reviews.Content: We were accommodated here by the airline after our flight was cancelled. The hotel is about a 10 minute ride from the airport, with free shuttles leaving every 30 minutes (:15 and :45 from hotel, :00 and :30 from airport). Friendly, service oriented staff at reception (and management). We were given connecting rooms, so our daughter could sleep quietly, and a late check-out until just before our flight the next day. Breakfast and lunch were adequate, nothing spectacular. Hotel feels spacious. Room was quiet, spacious enough, and clean. Contained 2 beds put together, the rolling wheels underneath them weren't too handy. Free wifi at the reception area only (internet in rooms via cable, paid).

Reviews.Title: “a little out the way”
Reviews.Author: shinealight1978
Reviews.Content: i was working at the rai centre and had little option but to stay here due to other events happing in amsterdam and was proving difficult to find anywhere. The room was fine, clean and comfortable. The communal areas were also immaculate. However, i did find the receptionists less than friendly and the shuttle bus from the airport is only a 8 seater. So if yr unfortunate to be late, you will have to wait over an hour for the next one and if a group turns up like it did when i was waiting, it came down to almost rushing the mini bus. The other down side i found is that the tram stop is over 15 minutes walk away and the last tram back leaves around midnight, so if you want to be out later, its a 40 euro taxi back

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: jumpinhorsedad
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotel experiences I have had in many years of both business and pleasure travel. I needed to stay here for the IBC conference and will never go back. They are definitely NOT capable in handling the business traveler. They lost my clothes in laundry twice. The internet failed. TV service was poor both in choice and quality. Rooms are classic European size and style but old and stuffy. Certainly no windows that open. The hotel was a Holiday Inn previously so it is NOT new - just simply got a name change. Don't be fooled. It appears as though the hotel's primary business is off tour groups. So repeat business does not seem to be on the agenda. These tour groups come through the hotel several bus loads at a time. Make sure to avoid counter times whenever these groups come through. Food and bar service was very very very slow. The staff seemed very friendly and really tried to perform great service but could not under the demands of the hotel. I wasn't the only patron to have a bad experience at this hotel. I heard several other patrons express very vocal serious disappointment in the service. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great option except for transport”
Reviews.Author: DigDigDig
Reviews.Content: Having read several negative reviews, I was pleasantly surprised by my stay. It appears management have responded to the negative feedback and are really working hard. The staff were pleasant and efficient, the room spacious and spotless with good views, the breakfast buffet most impressive. A huge tour group of youngsters checked in while I was there but, apart from that, everything was peace and quiet. The problem is accessibility from Amsterdam - either a 20-minute walk to the nearest tram stop (Matterhorn, Line 1) or â‚¬5 a go on the Schiphol shuttle bus, or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Option”
Reviews.Author: GRAI_9
Reviews.Content: Its a excellent option while staying in Netherlands, as its a bit far from the airport and the city, more reasons to get a great deal. They have shuttle service from the airport/railways making it simple. The tram station is a ten minute walk, from where tram 1 takes to central in 25 minutes. Excellent rooms with lovely views, a quiet locality and fresh hot breakfast, amazing choices. A great choice in a expensive city.
